title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Kokumbo Run-of-River Hydropower Project, through Knight Piesold

description.narrative: This grant to Kokumbo Energies S.A. will fund a feasibility study ("Study") to provide the technical information necessary to implement an estimated 27.7 megawatt run-of-river hydropower project on the Bandama River in Cote d'Ivoire. The Study will help to increase the market opportunities for U.S. companies and support Cote d'Ivoire in producing affordable, clean energy to meet its existing and growing energy demand. Knight Piesold and Co. (Denver, CO) is the sole source contractor implementing the Study.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

The Study will help to increase the market opportunities for U.S. companies and support Cote d'Ivoire in producing affordable, clean energy to meet its existing and growing energy demand. title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Cote d'Ivoire Cocoa Biomass Project, through Recast Energy LLC

description.narrative: This grant to Societe des Energies Nouvelles ("SODEN") funds a feasibility study ("Study") for the implementation of an estimated 60 to 70 megawatt biomass plant fueled by cocoa pod and other agricultural waste in Divo, Cote d'Ivoire ("Project"). The Project will provide renewable energy that will increase Cote d'Ivoire's energy security and create jobs. SODEN selected Recast Energy LLC (Richmond, VA) as the sole source contractor to complete the Study.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Smart Grid Study, through EnerNex

description.narrative: A USTDA grant to the Ministere de l'Economie et des Finances of Cote d'Ivoire will fund technical assistance (TA) to the Ministere du Petrole, de l'Energie et du Developpement des Energies Renouvelables and Societe des Energies de Cote d'Ivoire to support the improvement of the Ivorian electricity grid to decrease losses and provide higher-quality, lower cost electricity. The TA would provide a market opportunity for U.S. technologies and services in Cote d'Ivoire.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Cte dIvoire Port Logistics RTM, through Tuatara Group, LLC

description.narrative: This Cte dIvoire Port Logistics Reverse Trade Mission (RTM) will connect port sector representatives from Cte dIvoire with U.S. companies seeking to provide port technology and management operation services to the West African market. The RTM would showcase U.S. technologies and services to representatives from Cte dIvoire and expose participants to best-practices in port operations to support the implementation of improved port infrastructure in the Ports of Abidjan and San-Pedro.

title.narrative: Energy Access and Resiliency for 100 Communities, through Interface Engineering, Inc.

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study (Study) to determine the technical, financial and economic viability of building and operating decentralized mini-grids to support energy access for up to one-hundred (100) unelectrified communities in Cte d'Ivoire (Project). The grantee is the Ministre de l'Economie et des Finances of Cte dIvoire. The Ministre du Ptrole, de lnergie et du Dveloppement des nergies Renouvelables is the beneficiary and will implement the Project through its Direction Gnrale de lEnergie. If implemented, the Project could provide energy access for approximately 192,000 individuals. The Study would be competed among U.S. firms on the USTDA website and publicized via Sam.gov and highlighted through USTDA and Power Africa social media and marketing platforms.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Rice and Grains Import Terminal Feasibility Study, through Lixia Capsia Gestionis LLC

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study to support the development of a port-based grain terminal in Cte dIvoire to enable bulk shipments of rice and grain imports from the United States for value-added processing in Cte dIvoire mills for local consumption and potential export to neighboring countries. The grantee is HOTTER Cte dIvoire SARL, a leading Cte dIvoire cocoa and wholesale foods distributor, and the contractor is Lixia Capsia Gestionis, LLC.

The grantee is Hotter Cte dIvoire, Societe a Responsabilite Limitee (SARL), a leading Cte dIvoire cocoa and wholesale foods distributor, and the contractor is Lixia Capsia Gestionis, Limited Liability Corporation (LLC).

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Boundiali 25 Megawatt Cotton Stalk Biomass Project Technical Assistance, through Delphos International, Ltd.

description.narrative: This grant funds technical assistance (TA) to support Ecostar Energy, an independent power producer, to assess the financial, technical, socio-environmental, and legal aspects of the development of an estimated 25-megawatt biomass power plant in the Boundiali region of Cote d'Ivoire. Ecostar Energy selected Delphos International (Washington, D.C.) as the sole source contractor to complete the TA.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Port of Abidjan Truck Parking and Logistics Center Feasibility Study and Pilot Project, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study and pilot project that supports the Ministry of Transport's intent to expand and improve truck and freight movement around the Port of Abidjan in Cote d'Ivoire through the implementation of a long-term truck parking and logistics public private partnership. The study and pilot project is assessing the viability of information communication technology (ICT) solutions in truck control and management systems at the Port of Abidjan.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles
